children.text: There has not been adequate ventilation provided throughout the sub-floor, resulting in a damp environment, which according to the BCA, encourages timber rot, fungus growth and the potential for termite activity.
Part 3.4.1.2 of the National Construction Code’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) states that

‘Where the ground or subfloor space is excessively damp or subject to frequent flooding, the subfloor ventilation must be increased by 50%; or the ground within the subfloor space must be sealed with an impervious membrane; or subfloor framing must be above ground durability Class 1 or 2 timbers or H3 preservative treated timbers in accordance with AS 1684.2, AS 1684.3 or AS 1684.4’ .

As the sub-floor framing has not been constructed in Class 1 or 2 timbers or H3 preservative treated timbers, the builder will need to either increase the ventilation by 50%, or seal the space with an impervious membrane to comply with part 3.4.1.2 of the BCA.
